column4: btw, even though I can't find passwd, nor /sbin/passwd, nor /bin/passwd, nor /usr/bin/passwd, If I use ls -R | grep passwd it does find soemthing. I'm not expert on unix/linux though, how do I get the full path from it?
You could just use "which passwd" to tell the full path to the command
- the system can't find the command, that is why i'm searching for it :P
That means your system is pretty messed up...
Is your /usr on a separate partition?
- it's all virtual machine one disk, so no. But from some reason it's empty. I do know the command exists though, using 'ls -R | grep passwd' find some results, I'm just not sure where..
- ok, I found passwd in /etc/passwd . I can't run it though, it says permission denied.
Of course you can't run it
Eh, I have an idea here
Where X is a letter and Y is a number, something like "sda1" maybe
Okay, do just this: mount -o remount,rw /
That error is obviously a filesystem write eror
- minute, I executed a 'find' command and ctrl-c won't stop it xD
